第1回:
*All contents below subject to change, depending on needs and interests of the enrolled students.

Week 1: class overview, introductions, ice breakers
第2回: Week 2: Introduction of the Japanese and Canadian economies; discussion of first 280-word journal (economics topic #1)
第3回: Week 3: Womenomics and the role of working women in the Japanese economy; discussion of second 280-word journal (economics topic #2)
第4回: Week 4: Cryptocurrency, its growth, and impact on society; discussion of third 280-word journal (economics topic #3)
第5回: Week 5: The sharing economy: a look at Airbnb and Uber; discussion of fourth 280-word journal (hybrid topic #1)
第6回: Week 6: A critical comparison of Japanese and Canadian companies, discussion of fifth 280-word journal (business topic #1)
第7回: Week 7: Marketing in North America and Japan; discussion of sixth 280-word journal (business topic #2)
第8回: Week 8: The OECD better life index and its influence on business and society; discussion of seventh 280-word journal (business topic #3)
第9回: Week 9: Politics in North America: liberalism vs conservatism; discussion of eighth 280-word journal (politics topic #1)
第10回: Week 10: Legalization of drugs, or other social political issue; discussion of ninth 280-word journal (politics topic #2)
第11回: Week 11: Immigration policy, or other social political issue; discussion of final 280-word journal (politics topic #3)
トピック.授業外学習2: Each class will involve information and topics that will need to be applied to a final presentation. It is the students’ responsibility to make notes during each class so they can successfully accomplish this. Also, a 280-word weekly journal will be assigned involving the discussion contents of the next class. On average, this assignment should take one to two hours per week. You should have a stable wifi or internet connection at home to complete all out-of-class assignments.
